page.title: 01General Review
page.content: The centre of the block is largely unspoilt countryside, farmed in the traditional manner, quite surprising for an area so near major towns. In the NW lies the village of Burgh Heath, now bisected by the dual carriageway A 217. Here are modern council houses, as well as other houses, old and new, overlooking the large pond. The NE corner contains parts of the villages of Woodmansterne and Chipstead, with a variety of housing styles, but mostly at a rather high density. The SW corner is filled with very attractive, tree-lined avenues, with well spaced detached houses. The branch railway line wends its way from NE to SW, on its way from Purley to Chipstead, Kingswood, Tadworth and Tattenham Corner.
